answers.answer: Do you find an answer for your question ?. I do suffer burning feet pretty much every day only underlying condition i found is Hypothyroidism but my level is normal so not sure what else cause this .I don't have diabetes so far and other all possible things doctor has tested.Please share if you find an answer.

Hi,How are you?Diabetes is by far the most common cause of burning feet but it cannot be considered since it has been ruled out in your case.Other possibilities that can be considered are tarsal tunnel syndrome which causes nerve compression in the foot, B12 deficiency which can also cause peripheral neuropathy, chronic alcoholism and low platelets are other causes of burning feet.I would suggest you to get yourself examined by your PCP and discuss these possibilities. Take care!

question: I have been experiencing a burning, painfull sensation in the bottom of my feet.  I am not a diabetic nor have I sustained any injuries to my feet.  The pain/burning will last anywhere from approximately five minutes to one hour.  There are no precipitating factors that seem to lead to the sensation.  When they first started, they seemed to be very sporadic but now seem to be occurring with more frequency.Thanks,Mary
title: Burning sensation in feet
